title: 115_s438
content: The Act is known as the "Honoring Investments in Recruiting and Employing American Military Veterans Act of 2017" or the "HIRE Vets Act". It establishes the HIRE VETS Medallion Award Program. The HIRE Vets Act establishes a HIRE Vets Medallion Program for employers to receive awards for efforts in recruiting, employing, and retaining veterans, as well as providing community services. The Secretary of Labor will annually review voluntary applications from employers for the HIRE Vets Medallion Award. The HIRE Vets Act establishes a program for employers to receive awards for recruiting, employing, and retaining veterans. The Secretary of Labor reviews applications annually and announces recipients on Veterans Day. Applications are solicited by January 31st for awards in November. The Secretary sets deadlines for accepting applications, reviewing them, selecting recipients, and notifying employers for the HIRE Vets Medallion Awards. The Secretary sets deadlines for accepting applications and reviewing them for the HIRE Vets Medallion Awards. An employer cannot receive the award for two consecutive calendar years. SEC. 3. SELECTION OF RECIPIENTS. The Secretary reviews all applications to determine if an employer qualifies for a HIRE Vets Medallion Award based on their programs and efforts from the previous year. Verification of information provided is conducted to assess eligibility for the award. The Secretary reviews applications to determine if an employer qualifies for a HIRE Vets Medallion Award based on their programs and efforts from the previous year. Employers employing 500 or more employees can receive a Gold or Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion Award, with the CEO or CHRO attesting to meeting the criteria for a specific award level. Employers can receive a Gold HIRE Vets Medallion Award if veterans make up at least 7% of new hires, 75% of veteran employees are retained for 12 months, and an employee veteran organization is established for support. Employers can receive a Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion Award if they meet the requirements for a Gold award, have at least 10% of new hires as veterans, and enhance the leadership skills of veteran employees. Employers eligible for a Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion Award must retain 85% of veteran employees hired in the previous year for at least 12 months, employ dedicated HR professionals for veteran hiring and training, and provide sufficient compensation to employees serving in the National Guard or Reserve. Employers eligible for a Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion Award must retain 85% of veteran employees hired in the previous year for at least 12 months, provide sufficient compensation to employees serving in the National Guard or Reserve, and offer tuition assistance for veteran employees attending postsecondary education. Smaller employers with 5,000 or fewer employees can meet these requirements by employing at least one HR professional dedicated to veteran hiring and training. The Secretary may establish additional criteria for HIRE Vets Medallion Award qualifications. Awards for small- and medium-sized employers will be based on employee count. The Secretary will determine the design of the award certificate. The HIRE Vets Medallion Award criteria may include additional qualifications. Small- and medium-sized employers will be judged based on employee count. The award certificate design will be determined by the Secretary. The recipient of a HIRE Vets Medallion Award can publicly display the award and certificate. It is illegal for an employer to falsely display the award in any advertisement or business activity. It is illegal for an employer to falsely convey that they received the HIRE Vets Medallion Award through the program for a year when they did not actually receive the award. The HIRE Vets Medallion Award Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States, with fees collected from employers applying for the award. The fund will cover the costs of the HIRE Vets Medallion Award Program, subject to appropriation. The HIRE Vets Medallion Program will start accepting applications on January 31 two fiscal years after funds are first appropriated. A report will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary will submit annual reports to Congress on fees collected from HIRE Vets Medallion Award applicants, program administration costs, number of applications received, and awards granted, including employer names and award levels. The reports will be provided to specific committees. The Secretary will submit annual reports to specific committees in the House of Representatives and Senate on fees collected from HIRE Vets Medallion Award applicants, program administration costs, number of applications received, and awards granted. SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines key terms such as "employer," "Secretary," and "veteran."
